Our research aims to provide a comprehensive overview of these tech parks, focusing on key metrics such as foreign investment attraction, IT sector focus, average enterprise investment, and the distribution of businesses across various sectors.\n\n**Level of Foreign Investment Attraction**\n\nAccording to a report by the Philippine Economic Zone Authority (PEZA), Cebu IT Park has attracted a significant amount of foreign investment, with a total of 34.6% of its enterprises being foreign-owned [Source: PEZA, 2022]. In contrast, McKinley Hill Cyber has a foreign investment attraction rate of 27.1%, while Orion City has a rate of 21.5% [Source: BusinessWorld, 2022]. These figures indicate that Cebu IT Park is the most attractive destination for foreign investors among the three tech parks.\n\n**Focus on IT Sectors**\n\nThe three tech parks have a strong focus on IT sectors, with Cebu IT Park having 62.1% of its enterprises operating in the IT-BPM (Information Technology-Business Process Management) sector [Source: Cebu IT Park, 2022]. McKinley Hill Cyber has a slightly lower percentage, with 55.6% of its enterprises operating in the IT-BPM sector [Source: McKinley Hill Cyber, 2022]. Orion City, on the other hand, has a more diversified sector mix, with 45.6% of its enterprises operating in the IT-BPM sector [Source: Orion City, 2022].\n\n**Average Enterprise Investment**\n\nThe average enterprise investment in Cebu IT Park is approximately PHP 150 million (USD 2.7 million), with a median investment of PHP 100 million (USD 1.8 million) [Source: Cebu IT Park, 2022].
